content: First Quarter 2022, net revenues totaled 59 million comprised of 43 million from America's 9 million from IMEA, and 7 million from Apex, compared to the prior-year quarter, total revenues decreased by 3.4%. The increase from the prior-year quarter was primarily in an effort to normalize operation post-pandemic, versus in period prior year, as well as continued investments in the growth of the business, partially offset by a one-time favorable adjustments from the majority stockholder change of control agreement, accrual in 2021 and realized in January of 2022, Operating income was $2.1 million versus $2.7 million from the prior-year quarter. As Mike mentioned, we shifted back to profitability in the first quarter when net income attributable to SPAR Group, Inc of $674,000 of $0.03 per share compared to $917,000 or $0.04 per share in the year-ago quarter. Adjusted EBITDA attributable to SPAR Group, Inc in the 2022 first quarter was $1.5 million compared to $2.3 million in the prior year. The company's total worldwide liquidity at the end of first quarter was $18 million with $14 million in cash, cash equivalents, and restricted cash, and $4 million of unused durability as of March 31, 2022.
